revision.text: ==English== ===Etymology=== From {{bor|en|ar|يَهُودِيّ}}. ===Noun=== {{en-noun|s|Yahud}} # {{lb|en|Islam|rare}} A [[Jew]]. ===Further reading=== * {{cite-web|title=BBC slammed for mistranslating 'Yahud' as 'Israeli'|date=2019-05-14|last=Frantzman|first=Seth J.|work=The Jerusalem Post|url=https://www.jpost.com/Middle-East/BBC-slammed-for-mistranslating-Yahud-as-Israeli-comment-589658}} {{topics|en|Demonyms}} ---- ==Indonesian== ===Etymology=== From {{inh|id|ms|Yahudi}}, from {{der|id|ar|يَهُودِيّ}}. ===Proper noun=== {{head|id|proper noun}} # [[Jew]]s # [[Judaism]] # [[Hebrew]]s ---- ==Malay== ===Etymology=== From {{bor|ms|ar|يهودي}}. ===Proper noun=== {{head|ms|proper noun}} # [[Jew]]s # [[Judaism]] # [[Hebrew]]s (people) ---- ==Tausug== ===Noun=== {{head|tsg|noun}} # [[Jew]] ---- ==Turkish== ===Etymology=== From {{inh|tr|ota|یاهودی|tr=yahudi}}, borrowed from {{der|tr|ar|يَهُودِيّ}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|tr|[jɑhʊˈdi]}} ===Noun=== {{tr-noun|yi|ler}} # [[Jew]], adherent of [[Judaism]]. # A character in traditional Turkish [[shadow play]]s and {{w|orta oyunu|lang=tr}}. ====Declension==== {{tr-infl-noun-v|i|poss=1|pred=1}} ====Synonyms==== * {{sense|both senses}} {{l|tr|Musevi}} * {{l|tr|Çıfıt}} ====Derived terms==== * {{l|tr|Yahudilik}} * {{l|tr|Yahudi Soykırımı}} ===Adjective=== {{tr-adj}} # [[Jewish]], relating to Jews, their religion or their culture. {{topics|tr|Demonyms|Judaism}} ---- ==Yakan== ===Noun=== {{head|yka|noun}} # [[Jew]]
